DelftProto Virtual Machine

Instructions Namespace Reference

Detailed Description

All instructions and their opcodes.

Opcodes are declared as the name of the instruction with _OP appended.

Note:
Int, Int8, Int16 and IEEE754binary32 parameters are read from the byte(s) following the opcode. Address, Number, Tuple and Data parameters are taken from the execution stack. Stack parameters should be pushed in the same order as they are listed in this documentation.
The return value (if any) is pushed on the execution stack. If a mathematical formula is given in the documentation as return value, it is (obviously) a Number. In all other cases, the return type is explicitly described.

Function Documentation

void Instructions::DEF_VM ( Machine &  machine)

Define the VM requirements.

This should be executed before any other instruction.

Parameters:
Int8The export length. (This parameter is currently not used.)
Int8The number of exports.
Int16The number of globals.
Int8The number of state variables.
Int16The size of the execution stack.
Int8The size of the environment stack.

Only here for MIT Proto compatibility, deprecated.

Deprecated:
Implemented for MIT Proto compatibility. New scripts should use the similar DEF_VM_EX instead.

Definition at line 40 of file flow.cpp.

void Instructions::DEF_VM_EX ( Machine &  machine)

Define the (extended) VM requirements.

This should be executed before any other instruction.

Parameters:
IntThe size of the execution stack.
IntThe size of the environment stack.
IntThe number of globals.
IntThe number of threads.
IntThe number of state variables.
IntThe number of exports.
IntThe maximum execution depth (for instructions that execute functions, such as MAP).

Definition at line 79 of file flow.cpp.

void Instructions::EXIT ( Machine &  machine)

Exit the installation script.

This must be the last instruction of an installation script.

Definition at line 111 of file flow.cpp.

void Instructions::ALL ( Machine &  machine)

Clean the stack.

Preserve the top element while the rest of the given range is dropped. For example, after executing ALL_OP 3 on the stack [1 2 3 4], [1 4] is left.

Parameters:
Int8The number of elements to clean up.
Data[n] The elements on the stack.
Returns:
Data The top element.

Definition at line 125 of file flow.cpp.

void Instructions::NOP ( Machine &  machine)

Waste clockcycles.

Definition at line 132 of file flow.cpp.

void Instructions::MUX ( Machine &  machine)

Pick one of two values, using a condition.

Parameters:
NumberThe condition.
DataThe 'true' value.
DataThe 'false' value.
Returns:
Data The 'false' value when the condition is 0, the 'true' value otherwise.

void Instructions::IF ( Machine &  machine)

A conditional jump.

Skips the given number of bytes if the condition is not 0.

Parameters:
Int8The number of bytes to skip when the condition is true.
NumberThe condition.

template<int elements>
void Instructions::LET_N ( Machine &  machine)

Push one or more elements on the environment stack.

The given number of elements will be moved from the top of the execution stack to the environment stack.

Template Parameters:
elementsThe number of elements.
Parameters:
Data[n] The elements.

Definition at line 82 of file globals.cpp.

template<int size>
void Instructions::DEF_FUN_N ( Machine &  machine)

Define a function as a global.

The address of the next instruction is pushed on the globals list and execution continues after the function definition.

Template Parameters:
sizeThe number of (following) bytes that define the function.

Definition at line 95 of file globals.cpp.

Define a function as a global.

The address of the next instruction is pushed on the globals list and execution continues after the function definition.

Parameters:
Int8The number of (following) bytes that define the function.

void Instructions::VEC_ADD ( Machine &  machine)

Element wise addition of two numeric tuples.

Parameters:
TupleThe first numeric tuple.
TupleThe second numeric tuple.
Returns:
Tuple The result of an element wise addition.

If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.

TupleThe second numeric tuple.
Returns:
Number 1 when the elements in the tuples are equal, 0 otherwise.

If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.

void Instructions::VNEQ ( Machine &  machine)

Check if two numeric vectors are unequal.

Parameters:
TupleThe first numeric tuple.
TupleThe second numeric tuple.
Returns:
Number 0 when the elements in the tuples are equal, 1 otherwise.

If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.

Definition at line 43 of file specialform.cpp.

void Instructions::TUP_MAP ( Machine &  machine)

Map all elements of a Tuple using a function.

The given function will be called for every element in the tuple. The elements will be replaced by the corresponding return value of the function.

Parameters:
AddressThe (address of the) function to call.
TupleThe tuple of which the elements wil be mapped.
Returns:
Tuple The tuple with all the mapped elements.

Definition at line 101 of file specialform.cpp.

void Instructions::FOLD ( Machine &  machine)

Fold a Tuple to a single element with a given 'fuse function'.

The fuse function is used to consecutively fuse the previous fuse result with the next element of the Tuple. The first element will be fused with the given starting value.

For example, a tuple with three elements is folded like this:

If an empty Tuple is given, the starting value is returned.

Parameters:
AddressThe (address of the) fuse function. (The fold function must take two parameters.)
DataThe value to start with.
TupleThe tuple to fold.
Returns:
Data the result of the folding process.

void Instructions::INIT_FEEDBACK ( Machine &  machine)

Get and (if needed) initialize a state variable.

Note:
A state variable will be reset when no feedback instruction is used on it in a single run. It will be reinitialized by the next time INIT_FEEDBACK is executed.
Parameters:
Int8The index of the state variable.
AddressThe function to give the initial value, if not yet set.
Returns:
Data The value of the state variable.

void Instructions::FOLD_HOOD ( Machine &  machine)

Fold all imported values for a specific neighbourhood variable and update the corresponding export.

The fuse function is used to consecutively fuse the previous fuse result with the import value of the next neighbour. The import value from the first neighbour (ie. this machine) will be fused with the given starting value.

The value of the neighbour hood variable (ie. export) of this machine is set before the folding process starts.

For example, a neighbourhood with three neighbours (including this machine) is folded like this:

Deprecated:
Implemented for MIT Proto compatibility.
Note:
There is currently no way of doing this without using deprecated instructions. (This will be fixed soon.)
Parameters:
Int8The index of the neighbourhood (ie. import/export) variable.
AddressThe (address of the) fuse function. (The fold function must take two parameters.)
DataThe value to start with.
DataThe new export value for this Machine.
Returns:
Data the result of the folding process.

void Instructions::FOLD_HOOD_PLUS ( Machine &  machine)

Filter and fold all imported values for a specific neighbourhood variable and update the corresponding export.

The fuse function is used to consecutively fuse the previous fuse result with result of the filter applied to the import value of the next neighbour.

The value of the neighbour hood variable (ie. export) of this machine is set before the folding process starts.

For example, a neighbourhood with three neighbours (including this machine) is folded like this:

Deprecated:
Implemented for MIT Proto compatibility.
Note:
There is currently no way of doing this without using deprecated instructions. (This will be fixed soon.)
Parameters:
Int8The index of the neighbourhood (ie. import/export) variable.
AddressThe (address of the) fuse function. (The fold function must take two parameters.)
AddressThe (address of the) filter function. (The filter function must take one parameter.)
DataThe new export value for this Machine.
Returns:
Data the result of the folding process.
